The location is on Merdeka street Bandung, a bit inside from the main road. This time we came to break the fast with family, we had booked in advance. Entering the lobby is not too spacious, there are several sofa chairs. We arrived around 5 pm and went straight to the Parc De Ville restaurant on the 3rd floor. It was still quiet but the food and drinks were ready. When the Maghrib call to prayer sounded, the atmosphere was comfortable, not crowded, still quite spacious and 'all you can eat'. Some stalls & menus that I remember are: Middle Eastern cuisine (Beef Kebab, Nasi Mandi), there are Roti Boy & Kue Lumpur, then Umm Ali a great sweet cake with a cinnamon taste. There are Mie Bangladesh & Martabak Mesir which are savory. There are also Bakso & Cuankie, Gorengan, Coto Makasar. There are Nusantara & Local culinary with various types of food, also Traditional Dishes. There is a collection of Sweet Bread and also Salad Buffet Island. Lastly there is Bubur Kampiun with various mixtures. Of course there are still others including drinks. For me, the favorites are Beef Kebab and Coto Makasar, this one is a must try. Overall, everything tastes good, congratulations to the chef. There are clean toilets and a well-maintained prayer room. Just a suggestion, the lobby area should be given a hotel room perfume so that the atmosphere is fresh (Because when we entered the lobby there was an unpleasant smell). Enjoy the photos and videos.
